overview: Find out about terrorist threat levels, the Terrorism Acts, national measures against terrorism and how to report suspect activity
title: Terrorism and national emergencies

table.body:
The threat level indicates the likelihood of a terrorist attack in the UK.

There are 5 levels of threat:

- low - an attack is unlikely
- moderate - an attack is possible but not likely
- substantial - an attack is a strong possibility
- severe - an attack is highly likely
- critical - an attack is expected imminently

%The current threat level in Great Britain is substantial. The current threat level in Northern Ireland is severe.%

The level is set by the Joint Terrorism Analysis Centre.

Threat levels don't have an expiry date. They can change at any time as different information becomes available to security agents.

^Find out more about [terrorism threat levels on the Home Office website.](http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/counter-terrorism/current-threat-level/ "Home Office: terrorist threat levels"){:rel="external"}^

Counter terrorism

table.body:
If you suspect someone is involved in terrorism in any way:

- [contact the police](/contact-police "Contact the police")
- [report suspicious activity to MI5](/report-suspicious-activity-to-mi5 "Report suspect activity to MI5")

You can remain anonymous.

table.body:
##National Risk Register
The government regularly assesses the natural hazards and man-made threats that could affect the UK. 

These are published in the [National Risk Register.](http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.uk/resource-library/national-risk-register "National Risk Register"){:rel="external"} This explains the likelihood of a risk occurring and possible effects of an emergency if it happens.

##Local and central government preparations
Your local council, fire, police and ambulance services and other organisations take part in regular training exercises to prepare for emergencies. 

There are also government plans to make sure essential services, like food, water, transport, health and financial services, keep working in the event of an emergency.
